question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration. Help me design a small quiz competition game tool in HTML format, with content suitable for Party member study.

checklist.title: Is the quiz competition core system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements essential quiz functionalities including question display, answer selection mechanism, scoring system, and timer functions. Score 0 if core quiz logic is missing, 5 if only basic question display is implemented, and 10 if it includes a complete question bank with randomization, timing, and scoring mechanics.

checklist.title: Is the Party member study content appropriately integrated?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the quiz contains relevant content related to Party history, principles, policies, or current affairs. The questions should be factually accurate, educational, and aligned with Party values. Deduct 5 points if content is sparse or irrelevant, 3 points if content lacks depth or variety. Award full points only if content is comprehensive, educational and properly cited where necessary.

checklist.title: Does the game include progress tracking and feedback mechanisms?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements user progress tracking (such as current score, questions answered, success rate) and provides meaningful feedback after answers (explanations for correct answers, learning points for incorrect ones). Deduct 5 points if there's no progress indicator, 3 points if feedback is minimal. Full points require comprehensive statistics and educational feedback.

checklist.title: Is there competition or multiplayer functionality?
checklist.description: Assess whether the tool includes any competitive elements such as leaderboards, time-based challenges, multi-player functionality, or achievement systems. Score 3 points for basic score comparison, 7 points for a functional leaderboard, and 10 points for implemented real-time or turn-based multiplayer competition with proper user identification.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, unexpected user behavior, browser compatibility issues) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Dynamic difficulty adjustment based on user performance 2. Interactive educational content between questions 3. Visual representations of Party history or achievements). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple scoring systems coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to Party education or quiz gameplay 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow down question transitions). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating quiz logic/view layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the HTML structure is not semantic or accessible. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (preferably using official Party colors appropriately) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows consistent principles) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, clear hierarchy). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for inappropriate color combinations, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance for quiz navigation. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for jarring transitions between questions, and 5 points for confusing navigation or answer selection mechanics. The full score is 10 points.
